summary: This document is an email or post from July 26, 2019, summarizing an Infowars report by Alex Jones. It alleges the 'Arkancide' (murder disguised as suicide) of FBI Agent Salvatore Cincinelli, who was investigating the Clinton Foundation, and an attempted 'Arkancide' of Jeffrey Epstein. It connects Epstein to Bill Clinton via the 'Lolita Express' flights.

persons.name: Salvatore Cincinelli
persons.context: FBI agent who was investigating the Clinton Foundation; the document alleges he was a victim of 'Arkancide' (murder presented as suicide) via a self-inflicted fatal gunshot wound in public.

persons.name: Alex Jones
persons.context: Host of Infowars who phoned in the bombshell report detailing the alleged 'Arkancide' of Salvatore Cincinelli and attempted 'Arkancide' of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of an attempted 'Arkancide'; connected to Bill Clinton and referenced as the owner of the 'Lolita Express' aircraft.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Reportedly flew on Jeffrey Epstein's 'Lolita Express' at least 26 times; his foundation (Clinton Foundation) was under investigation by Salvatore Cincinelli.

connections.description: Cincinelli was an FBI agent investigating the Clinton Foundation.
Bill Clinton reportedly flew on Jeffrey Epstein's 'Lolita Express' aircraft at least 26 times.
Both are subjects of alleged 'Arkancide' events as reported by Alex Jones.

events.title: Infowars Report on 'Arkancides'
events.description: Alex Jones reports on the alleged 'Arkancide' of FBI Agent Salvatore Cincinelli and the attempted 'Arkancide' of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Death of Salvatore Cincinelli
events.description: FBI Agent Salvatore Cincinelli died from a self-inflicted fatal gunshot wound in public, allegedly motivated by a phone call from his sister. The document suggests foul play due to his Clinton Foundation investigation.

events.title: Attempted 'Arkancide' of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: An alleged attempted murder of Jeffrey Epstein, falsely presented as a suicide attempt.

keyFacts: The document promotes the conspiracy theory of 'Arkancide'—murder disguised as suicide—linked to the 'Clinton body count.'
It alleges FBI Agent Salvatore Cincinelli was killed via 'Arkancide' while investigating the Clinton Foundation.
It alleges an attempted 'Arkancide' of Jeffrey Epstein.
It claims Bill Clinton flew on Epstein's 'Lolita Express' at least 26 times.
The source is an Infowars report by Alex Jones, dated July 25, 2019.
